lines.text: Wake up, Ben. Hey, rise and shine, big boy. How you feeling?
Where am I?
Back on Earth. We're in quarantine. Victor's medical facility.
Reed? Sue?
Oh, they're fine. Everybody else is fine.
What's wrong with me?
I swear to you, Ben, they've done everything humanly possible. The best plastic surgeons in the world are here, Ben. You had the best.
[Johnny picks up a hand mirror on the bed table before Ben can reach it, reluctant to give it to him]
Give me that mirror.
I don't think if that's a good idea. They said the shock alone...
I said, give me that goddamn mirror!
Okay, Ben. Just be strong.
[Ben grabs it from him. Then slowly raises it to look and see that he's totally normal]
Unfortunately, the doctors just couldn't do anything to fix your face.
It's got to be the cloud! It's fundamentally altered our DNA!
Now, let's not jump to conclusions. We need much more scientific evidence before we can say that.
Hey, guys!
[his thumb is on fire. He snaps his fingers, and it goes out. He snaps it on again, then off again]
Now picture that... But everywhere! I mean... Everywhere! *What*?
...The cloud has fundamentally altered our DNA.

[taking Johnny's temperature which charges the electronic thermometer to 209 degrees]
My God! You're hot!
Why, thank you. So are you.
I'm trying to figure out why we each ended up with different symptoms.
I'm hot. You're... well, you're a little limp. Sue's easy to see through. And Ben's always been a hardass.

[proposing to Sue Storm]
Four words, Sue. Four words that will change our lives forever...

[interrupting]
The cloud is accelerating!
You were at 4,000 degrees Kelvin! You were approaching Super-Nova!
Sweet!
No, not "sweet"! That's the heat of the sun!
You could kill yourself, other people, and burn up the atmosphere, ending all human life as we know it.
Got it. Super-Nova bad.
You know, living through something like this you really appreciate having the right woman in your life.
Yeah, you and Debbie are perfect.
I'm not talking about Debbie.
[Indicates to Sue]
What? Come on. She's got a good thing with Victor. He's smart, He's powerful, successful.
Well, maybe you should date him then.
Ben, she ended up with the right guy, everything worked out for the best.
[Reed walks away]
Do I have to do everything myself?
All right, I'm here, let's make this quick, I've got a lot of places to go today. Oh wait - I don't go anywhere!
Johnny, it's imperative that we stay inside for the foreseeable future.
I know, I know, but when you said that last time my brain hurt a week.
Johnny, it's too dangerous for you to be in public.
You've been saying that for years.
Do you really think fate turned us into gods so we could refuse these gifts?
Victor, you *always* thought you were a god. Now back off.
Susan, let's not fight.
No, let's!
Hey, no more wise cracks about the way I look.
Hey, call me Mr. Sensitivity.

[walking through the crowd]
Okay, wide load coming through! Everybody move! He's huge!
Hey! Come here, Mr. Sensitive.
Flame on!
Show-off!
[Johnny flies into the sky to make a fiery 4]

[Sitting on the Brooklyn Bridge]
Oh yeah Ben, few days in space, it'll be great, what's the worst that could happen?
[after he falls off his snowboard and lights on fire, melting the snow around him into water, talking to nurse]
Care to join me?
[Susan has just taken off all of her clothes while she was invisible]
I'm gonna need therapy.

[Ben enters the lobby]
Hey! Look what the marketing guys did! Look, check it out, listen, listen, you'll love this...
[holds up a little Thing doll that says, "It's clobberin' time!" in a squeaky voice]
It's catchy, right?
[giggles]
Isn't that great?
[Ben takes the figure from Johnny, smashes it into the wall and stomps away]
Aww, that was the prototype!
[Susan's invisibility has worn off and she's now standing in front of a crowd in her underwear]
I see you've been working out.
Shut up!

[to Ben, after first seeing him as The Thing]
Where are your ears?

[while fighting Victor Von Doom]
Johnny! Supernova!
I thought we agreed that was bad!
Now!
Johnny! You're on fire!
Thanks! You're pretty good too!
How many times have I ever asked you to do something that you said you absolutely could not do?
Five times.
[walks off]
I had it at four.

[from offscreen]
Well, this is number five.
Ladies, I'm gonna need to borrow your car.
The transmission sticks.
Not gonna be a problem!
[hurls the car in the direction of Doom]
[extends his arm, stretching it under a metal door, and bringing his hand up to the window on the other side]
That's gross!
[as the four enter the elevator, it creaks and from Ben's massive body weight]
Either we're moving really fast or not at all.
[the elevator's "exceed maximum weight" sign lights up]
I'll take the stairs.

[referring to Ben]
What is that? What do you call that thing?
That's it - the Thing. Yeah, you think this is bad, you should have seen him before!
Okay. Now I'm gonna go kill him!

[Talking about his home]
So what do you think?
I don't know Reed, I think you might be taking you work home with you.

[to Reed, after the fight with Ben]
What?
You need to control yourself, and think before you act.
Yeah, but you see, that's your problem; you always think, you never act! What if we got these powers for a reason? What if it's like some higher calling?
A higher calling? Like getting girls and making money?
Is there any higher? You know what Reed - this is who we are. Accept it. Or better yet, enjoy it.

[to Doom, after he sent a heat seeking missile after him]
You missed me!

[referring to Reed, Susan and Johnny in their new outfits]
You guys look like an '80s rock band!

[complaining about Johnny]
That underwear model washed out at NASA for bringing two Victoria's Secret wannabes into a flight simulator.
Youthful high spirits.
They crashed it into a wall.
You don't want to walk around on fire for the rest of your life, do you?
Is that a trick question?
It's time to end this.
No, Vic. It's clobbering time!
[he sends Dr. Doom flying. A metal painting falls on the latter]
Damn, I've been waiting to do that!

[shaking head sadly, trying to make Alicia understand]
You don't know what it's like out there. Walking around like some kind of circus freak. People staring, whispering...

[sarcastically]
I wouldn't know anything about that.

[instantly contrite]
I mean...
[first lines]
Typical of Victor Von Doom to build a 30 foot statue of himself.

[after finding out that he's working for Johnny]
I cannot take orders from the underwear model.
A few days in space. What's the worst that could happen?

[to Johnny as a heat-seeker rocket is heading towards them]
Don't even think about it!
Never do.
[he jumps off the Baxter Building]
Exposure to a high energy cosmic storm could advance our knowledge of planetary life.
Same old Reed, always stretching, reaching for the stars.

[about the machine that could change them back to normal]
What are the risks?
Even a small miscalculation could increase our symptoms exponentially - or perhaps even kill us.
Now, dying - that's bad, right?

[to Reed]
Hey. Nice do. Likin' the grandpa look.
Ben, I've been crunching the numbers on the machine. I think if we can rework the power settings...

[casually]
Forget it, egghead. I'm good as is.

[approaches and hands Ben a large metal mug of beer]
Better than good, baby.
[they clink glasses causing hers to shatter]
You just... need to work on your touch.

[hugging her and smiling widely]
I like the sound of that.
Who's the leader?
That would be me!
No, really.

[after Victor was talking about him]
Reed does the talking. I do the walking.
So take a walk, Ben.

[to Ben]
I swear to you... I will do everything in my power until there is not a breath left in me- You're gonna be Ben again.
Come on, Ben. Smile. They wanna like you, bud. Say hi.
[to a group of little kids]
Uh, don't do drugs!
[to Johnny as they wait for the traffic light to turn green]
Where's your hot sister and the monster?
[Johnny hurls a fireball that smacks Ben in the back of his head]
Did you just...?
[gets another fireball in the face]
Johnny, stop it!
That's it, Tinker Bell! You wanna fly? Then fly!
[in a heated fight with Ben]
Let's see if we can get blood from a stone.
[Johnny has engulfed Dr. Doom in a huge fire cone that has just burned away Doom's clothes and outer skin]
Is that the best you can do?
Time for your lesson - Chem 101. What happens when you rapidly cool hot metal?
[the Thing smashes a water hydrant and soaks Dr. Doom, solidifying his metal form and immbolizing him]

[after he turns Ben to normal]
Take a good look Ben. This is what a man looks like who embraces his destiny.
[punches Ben and sends him crashing]
One down - three to go.

[appearing on the landing]
Vic?
Right on cue!
I've always wanted power. Now I have an unlimited supply.
And no Thing to stand in your way.

[in Ben's defense]
This is Ben Grimm here - the first mook from Brooklyn to go into outer space. So pay him some respect.

[Johnny is snapping his fingers and a flame is going on and off]
I said cut it out Johnny. Johnny.Stop!
All right.
All right?
Yes!
*God*

[mockingly]
God.
What is wrong with you?
What?
Uhhh!
If you're good, maybe daddy'll let you drive.
You keep talking and there won't be a next time!
What worries me is that our powers are evolving.
I know - I know! I'm so close to flying, guys, I can taste it.
You can't fly.
Yet.
You know, being different isn't always a bad thing.
Trust me, this ain't one of them times.
Not if you don't want it to be.
[watching Johnny on TV at the Moto-X Games]
He didn't.
Oh, yes, he did! Flame boy never listens!
What did he do to his uniform?
Johnny, I've got to ask you about this outfit.
Yeah, it's sorta Armani meets astronaut.
So, what are your superhero names?
They call me the Human Torch. Ladies call me Torch.
What about the rest of the team?
[Sue's picture is shown on the huge screen]
That's the Invisible Girl.
"Girl"?
What about your leader, Reed Richards? I hear you call him Mr. Fantastic.
Could've been worse.
I guess.
Johnny!
What?
You gave us names? You don't think! So now you're the face of the Fantastic Four?
A face that's about to be broken!
We're all in this together, Ben.
Together? Susie, look at me. You got no idea what I'd - what I'd give to be invisible.
[Reed opens the bathroom door as Sue get's out]

[Sue goes invisible]
You could knock!
Sorry.
[Reed slams the door shut]

[about Reed]
Is it true what they say about him? That he can expand *any* part of his anatomy?
Well, I've always found him to be a little limp.
Excuse me. That thing doesn't look so fantastic.
Ben Grimm is a genuine American hero.
What he means is, every team needs a mascot.
[the reporters laugh]
A new day is dawning. *The day of the Fantastic Four!*
What I see in your relationship is what I considered the best part of ours.
That is?
Passion... for science.
[Ben Grimm sees a man about to jump off the Brooklyn Bridge]
Hey! You think you got problems, you take a good look, pal.

[Sue turns invisible, then begins taking off her clothes but loses her invisibility]
I'm going to need therapy.

[diving off a building trying to turn his power on]
Come on, come on, come on. Flame on!

[after he accidentally shatters his vat of alcohol]
If there is a God, he hates me.
*She* is not so into hate.

[after The Thing demolishes his red Porsche]
You think that's funny, Pebbles?

[after Johnny has ignited during a biker stunt]
He's ok! He's all right! I have to give you props Johnny. You were on fire!
Isn't it funny the way things turn out?
Hilarious.
Please tell me your guy's not trying to rekindle things with my sister again.
Of course not. It's strictly business.
Yes. Well, his eyes say differently, don't they?
Hey. Two hearts got busted last time. Maybe she's not over it either.
world's dumbest smart guy, worth less than a postage stamp. That's a real toss-up.
Don't trouble your tiny little mind.
Don't wander off now, boy.
Digital camera - $250. Memory stick - $59. The look on your hard-ass former C.O.'s face when he finds out he's your junior pilot - priceless.

[to Reed]
Why the long face? Let's talk in my office.

[after leaning in to kiss Sue, she turns invisible]
... That's not fair.
How bad is it? You know, I used to smoke.
You know, you could'a run an ad in the personals.
Sensual blind chick seeks three-ton, rock-hard he-man for deep spiritual relationship.

[sounding more hopeful than realistic]
This ain't permanent. My friend Reed is working on a cure... I think.
Bennie... you feel good 'as is'.

[to Ben]
Tell me, when you grew up in Brooklyn, how many astronauts did you know? You went your own way then. You didn't listen to people. So why start now?

[stripping off her clothes while trying to escape the mob]
I can't believe I'm doing this again!

[about Reed's re-transformation machine]
So, how long til this contraption is up and running?
I don't know, it's hard to say.
How long, Reed?
I don't know, uh...

[upset]
You don't know?
You don't want this to get worse?
Worse than *that*?

[after Ben has transformed back to the Thing]
Had a little relapse, huh? Welcome back!
Remember our first date here? God, I was nervous!
You know, I'd bribed the projectionist ten bucks to keep the place open late.
Really?
Mm.
I gave him twenty!
[Susan and Reed enter the laboratory happily chatting, but fall silent when they become aware of Ben waiting for them]
Yeah - I have that effect on people.
Good thing you're flexible enough to watch your own back... 'cause I ain't doing it no more.

[facing the Fantastic Four in full strength]
This is gonna be fun!
[Susan unexpectedly generates a force field which knocks Reed off his chair]
I'm so sorry! Are you OK?
Yeah.
You're sure?
Yeah.
I - uh - you probably thought that was some form of latent hostility.
What in the world would give me that idea?
All the accomplishments in the world mean nothing without someone to share them with.

[puts thermometer in nurse's pocket]
That's yours.
[kisses nurse]
That's mine.

[referring to the nurse]
My future wife!

[to Victor]
Uh, sir, Larry King just canceled. Apparently there's a bigger story.
It's too dangerous for you to go out into public.
You've been saying that for years.
His internal organs are completely solid.

[invisible]
Look at me!
I can't.
Johnny, have you seen Ben?
Yeah, Sunshine just left. Look Sue, I'm sorry, I... I can't stay in this freak show, I gotta get back to the real world.
You're calling that the real world?
Sue stop, you're not mum, don't talk to me like I'm a little boy, okay?
Maybe I would if you stopped acting like one! Do you even hear yourself? Who do you think you are?
Why is everyone on my ass? If you guys are jealous, that's fine; I didn't expect it to come from you though.
You really think those people out there care about you? You're just a fad to them, Johnny!
Let's try something new. You live your life, I'll live mine. Sound good?
[before Johnny walks out of the Baxter Building, he turns back to Sue]
Oh, and just for the record - they love me!
[Ben zips Johnny's suit all the way up]
Thank you. That's so sweet.
I can handle this ship. I can even handle Mr. Blonde Ambition. But I don't know if I should be flying or doing Swan Lake in these suits.

[to Johnny]
Is it true you can fly?
Yeah, I'm working on that, its actually really difficult.

[to Victor]
About the I.P.O.- no hard feelings, right? Nothing personal. You know, you could always move back to Latveria and start fresh. Maybe that's where you belong - the old country.
[Victor shoots electricity through Ned's body which burns a hole in his chest]
Nothing personal, Ned... but I'm not going anywhere.
I need names... and shots. Bartender!
[Reed tries to kiss an invisible Sue]
That's my nose, genius. These are my lips.
[she kisses him]

[to Reed]
You're such a dork.
Call me Doom.
Your entire biophysical structure is changing.
That's terrible news.
[he kills the Doctor]
I think I'll get a second opinion.
Sir, I have always wondered. Why Sue? You could have any other woman in the world.
That's why. Because I could have any other woman.

[at the art gallery, with Ben]
Look around. I'll get us drinks. They always let blind girls cut the line.

[heading toward the door]
See you later, Ben.
[pauses and turns around]
I'm Alicia, by the way.
You done good, kid.
[Standing in underware, yelling at Reed]
Any more bright ideas? Why don't you strip down and have a hundred people stare at you!
You know that looked cool!
I found a broken gasket from space.

[after trying to make a phone call when first becoming the Thing]
Little buttons!
Susan, you're fired!

[looking in the mirror while talking to his assistant]
Get me on the a.m. shows, Larry King, cover of the Journal. Gonna have to do something about this scar. Make sure they only shoot me from my left side.

[torturing Reed]
Painful? You don't know the meaning of the word.

[in a fight with Reed]
Get off me, rubber boy!
Two down. Two to go.
